hypothesis_content.title: BTC 4H Bollinger Band Squeeze Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC enters a period of low volatility (Bollinger Band Width on 4H chart < 0.02) within a NEUTRAL regime, the subsequent directional breakout on a 4H candle close, confirmed by volume > 1.5x the 20-period average, will sustain for at least 2% in the breakout direction before a significant reversal.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often feature range compression before directional moves. A Bollinger Band squeeze identifies this compression, and a volume-confirmed breakout signals institutional or large trader participation, increasing odds of follow-through. The 2% target is a typical volatility expansion target post-squeeze.
entry_conditions: BTC 4H Bollinger Band (20,2) Width < 0.02 for at least 6 consecutive 4H candles
4H candle closes above upper band (for long) or below lower band (for short)
Volume on breakout candle > 1.5x 20-period 4H volume average

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakout candle low (for long) or high (for short)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 48 hours after entry if TP/SL not hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such signals result in a 'false breakout' (price returns inside the bands before achieving the 2% target) over a 6-month backtest period.
